com.oracle.truffle.api.debug

Class Debugger

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.oracle.truffle.api.debug.Debugger

  • public final class Debugger
extends Object
    Represents debugging related state of a PolyglotEngine.

    Access to the (singleton) instance in an engine, is available via:

    • Debugger.find(PolyglotEngine)
    • Debugger.find(TruffleLanguage.Env)
    • DebuggerSession.getDebugger()
    To start new debugger session use Debugger.startSession(SuspendedCallback). Please see DebuggerSession for a usage example.

    The debugger supports diagnostic tracing that can be enabled using the -Dtruffle.debug.trace=true Java property. The output of this tracing is not guaranteed and will change without notice.

    Since:
    0.9
    See Also:
    Debugger.startSession(SuspendedCallback), DebuggerSession, Breakpoint

    • Method Detail

      • startSession

        public DebuggerSession startSession(SuspendedCallback callback)
        Starts a new session provided with a callback that gets notified whenever the execution is suspended.
        Parameters:
        callback - the callback to notify
        Since:
        0.17
        See Also:
        DebuggerSession, SuspendedEvent

      • getLoadedSources

        public List<Source> getLoadedSources()
        Returns a list of all loaded sources. The sources are returned in the order as they have been loaded by the languages.
        Returns:
        an unmodifiable list of sources
        Since:
        0.17

      • find

        public static Debugger find(PolyglotEngine engine)
        Finds debugger associated with given engine. There is at most one debugger associated with any PolyglotEngine.
        Parameters:
        engine - the engine to find debugger for
        Returns:
        an instance of associated debugger, never null
        Since:
        0.9

      • find

        public static Debugger find(TruffleLanguage.Env env)
        Finds the debugger associated with a given language environment. There is at most one debugger associated with any PolyglotEngine. Please note that a debugger instance looked up with a language also has access to all other languages and sources that were loaded by them.
        Parameters:
        env - the language environment to find debugger for
        Returns:
        an instance of associated debugger, never null
        Since:
        0.17
